alert.note: Alert for Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 12:40AM CDT until further notice by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Osage and Pawnee. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. A flash flood warning may be required for portions of the advisory area if thunderstorms persist well into the overnight hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sand Springs... Skiatook... Hominy... Cleveland... Sperry... Jennings... Avant... Westport... Osage... Hallett... Blackburn... Terlton... Maramec... Walnut Creek State Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
